fetchSettings.description: System level settings for controlling fetch behavior and performance.

fetchItemQueueSize.description: Size of the fetch item queue.Larger values result in increased memory usage, but potentially higher performance.Default is 100.
fetchItemQueueSize.title: Fetch Item Queue Size

fetchRequestCheckInterval.description: The amount of time to wait before check if a request is done
fetchRequestCheckInterval.title: Fetch request check interval(ms)

fetchResponseCompletedTimeout.description: The maximum amount of time for a response to be completed. If exceeded, the task will be retried if the job is still running
fetchResponseCompletedTimeout.title: Fetch response completion timeout(ms)

fetchResponseScheduledTimeout.description: The maximum amount of time for a response to be scheduled. The task will be canceled if this setting is exceeded.
fetchResponseScheduledTimeout.title: Fetch response scheduled timeout(ms)

numFetchThreads.description: Maximum number of fetch threads; defaults to 4.This setting controls the number of threads that call the Connectors fetch method.Higher values can, but not always, help with overall fetch performance.
numFetchThreads.title: Fetch Threads

fetchSettings.title: Fetch Settings

pipelineSettings.description: System level settings for IndexPipeline API calls.

retryOptions.description: A set of options for configuring retry behavior.

errorExclusions.description: Optional regex list that will be matched against failed attempts exception class and message. If any regex matches, do not retry this request. This is needed to prevent the retryer from retrying non-recoverable errors that were not already ignored by the connector implementation.
errorExclusions.title: Error Exclusions

maxDelayTimeMs.description: The retryer will retry failed operations in the case that they might succeed if attempted again. The retryer will sleep an exponential amount of time after the first failed attempt and retry in exponentially incrementing amounts after each failed attempt up to the maximumTime. This parameter sets a maximum on the sleep time. NOTE: This does NOT mean a request will stop retrying after this time, rather it is just a cap on how big the sleeps between requests can get from the multiplier.
maxDelayTimeMs.title: Maximum Delay Time

maxInMemoryBuffer.description: The maximum in-memory buffer size (bytes) before content is temporarily spilled-over to disk.This allows the indexing process to retry content without forcing the Connector to provide it again.Content smaller than this setting is buffered in-memory.
maxInMemoryBuffer.title: Maximum In-Memory Buffer

maxRetries.description: The retryer will retry failed operations in the case that they might succeed if attempted again. This parameter states the number of attempts to retry until giving up. This parameter, if specified, will override the "Stop retrying after time (milliseconds)" parameter.
maxRetries.title: Maximum Retries

maxTimeLimitMs.description: The retryer will retry failed operations in the case that they might succeed if attempted again. This parameter states how long since the first attempt (in seconds) that the retryer will continue to make reattempts. Note: This parameter will be ignored if the maximum retry attempts setting is specified.
maxTimeLimitMs.title: Maximum Time Limit

retryFactor.description: The retryer will retry failed operations in the case that they might succeed if attempted again. The retryer will sleep an exponential amount of time after the first failed attempt and retry in exponentially incrementing amounts after each failed attempt up to the maximumTime. nextWaitTime = exponentialIncrement * multiplier.
retryFactor.title: Retry Factor

retryOptions.title: Retry Options

pipelineSettings.title: Pipeline Settings

created.description: The date at which this Configuration was created.
created.title: Date Created

diagnosticLogging.description: Enable diagnostic logging; disabled by default
diagnosticLogging.title: Diagnostic Logging

id.description: A unique identifier for this Configuration.
id.title: Configuration ID

modified.description: The date at which this Configuration was last modified.
modified.title: Date Modified

parserId.description: The Parser to use in the associated IndexPipeline.
parserId.title: Parser ID

pipeline.description: Name of the IndexPipeline used for processing output.
pipeline.title: Pipeline ID

addFileMetadata.description: Add information about documents found in the file system to the index, such as document owner, ACLs, etc.
addFileMetadata.title: Add File Metadata

maxDepth.description: Maximum depth level for fetch items. If an item has a depth greater than the configured value, it will not be fetched. The default is "no limit" (-1).
maxDepth.title: Maximum Item Depth

includeDirectories.description: When true, directory items are indexed as documents.
includeDirectories.title: Index Directories

initialFilePaths.description: Set of initial paths to crawl.
initialFilePaths.title: File Paths to crawl

maxItems.description: Limits the number of items emitted to the configured IndexPipeline. The default is no limit (-1).
maxItems.title: Maximum Output Limit

excludedFileExtensions.description: A set of all file extensions to be skipped from the fetch.
excludedFileExtensions.title: Excluded file extensions

exclusiveRegexes.description: Regular expressions for URI patterns to exclude. This will limit this datasource to only URIs that do not match the regular expression.
exclusiveRegexes.title: Exclusive regexes

includedFileExtensions.description: Set of file extensions to be fetched. If specified, all non-matching files will be skipped.
includedFileExtensions.title: Included file extensions

inclusiveRegexes.description: Regular expressions for URI patterns to include. This will limit this datasource to only URIs that match the regular expression.
inclusiveRegexes.title: Inclusive regexes

regexCacheSize.description: The number of regex matches to cache when evaluating regular expressions. For example if you exclude files by filename, each filename's regex result will be cached so that if this same filename came up again, the regex matches would be remembered.
regexCacheSize.title: Regex Cache Size

sizeLimitProperties.description: Options for including or excluding items based on size, in bytes.

maxSizeBytes.description: Used for excluding items when the item size is larger than the configured value.
maxSizeBytes.title: Maximum

minSizeBytes.description: Used for excluding items when the item size is smaller than the configured value.
minSizeBytes.title: Minimum

sizeLimitProperties.title: Item Size Limits

type.description: A type ID for this connector.
type.title: Type
